dt: {bc}a systematic statement of a body of law
{bc}a system of signals or symbols for communication
{bc}a system of symbols (such as letters or numbers) used to represent assigned and often secret meanings
{bc}coded language {bc}a word or phrase chosen in place of another word or phrase in order to communicate an attitude or meaning without stating it explicitly

dt.t: The strategy also appealed to blue-collar workers in the Northeast and Northwest who were opposed to {ldquo}forced bussing.{rdquo} This was expressed in {wi}code{/wi} as favoring {ldquo}law and order{rdquo} and opposing {ldquo}crime in the streets.{rdquo}
I hear the word {ldquo}development{rdquo} a lot in public speech; politicians and activists use it as {wi}code for{/wi} a lot of things—jobs, health care, a change in leadership.
This quarter-century of Republican momentum was reversed finally by Bill Clinton, who called himself a {ldquo}New Democrat,{rdquo} {wi}code for{/wi} {ldquo}not a liberal.{rdquo}

dt: {bc}instructions for a computer (as within a piece of software)

et: Middle English, from Middle French, from Latin {it}caudex, codex{/it} trunk of a tree, document formed originally from wooden tablets
shortdef: a systematic statement of a body of law; especially : one given statutory force
a system of principles or rules
a system of signals or symbols for communication

dt: {bc}to put in or into the form or symbols of a code

dt.t: a gene that {wi}codes{/wi} for a protein
She got a job {wi}coding{/wi} for Google.

shortdef: to put in or into the form or symbols of a code
to create or edit computer code

dt: {bc}a usually 3-digit number that identifies a particular telephone service area in a country (such as the U.S. or Canada)

shortdef: a usually 3-digit number that identifies a particular telephone service area in a country (such as the U.S. or Canada)

dt: {bc}a code consisting of a group of printed and variously patterned bars and spaces and sometimes numerals that is designed to be scanned and read into computer memory and that contains information (such as identification) about the object it labels

dt.t: … one version of the {wi}barcode{/wi} reader used in supermarkets employs a laser scanner.
I on the other hand boarded the traditional way. I handed my paper printout to the airport personnel, who scanned the {wi}barcode{/wi} before letting me proceed.

dt: {bc}something (such as a DNA sequence) that uniquely identifies a species of organism

dt.t: … they now plan to analyze each fish sample by decoding a certain tiny piece of DNA that can serve as a unique {wi}bar code{/wi} for the species.

shortdef: a code consisting of a group of printed and variously patterned bars and spaces and sometimes numerals that is designed to be scanned and read into computer memory and that contains information (such as identification) about the object it labels
something (such as a DNA sequence) that uniquely identifies a species of organism

dt: {bc}any of various racially discriminatory laws that were passed in 1865 and 1866 in states that had been part of the {d_link|Confederate States of America|Confederate States of America:g} and that were enacted in order to maintain white supremacy {dx_def}see {dxt|white supremacy||2}{/dx_def} after the formal abolition of slavery at the end of the American Civil War

et: probably translation of French {it}Code Noir,{/it} any of several law codes regulating free or enslaved Africans, or persons of African descent, in French Caribbean colonies and Louisiana
shortdef: any of various racially discriminatory laws that were passed in 1865 and 1866 in states that had been part of the Confederate States of America and that were enacted in order to maintain white supremacy after the formal abolition of slavery at the end of the American Civil War

dt: {bc}the act or an instance of fraudulently deceiving {bc}{sx|deception||}, {sx|fraud||}

dt.t: His financial activity turned out to be a great {wi}cheat{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a code (such as a button combination or password) that activates a hidden feature or capability in a computer or video game

dt.t: In fact, some game levels are so tough that I had to resort to {wi}cheats{/wi} to get through.
Most people think that using a {wi}cheat code{/wi} is the only way to earn a dishonest reward …

et: probably from a deceptive resemblance to grain

dt: {bc}the obtaining of property from another by an intentional active distortion of the truth

et: earlier {it}cheat{/it} forfeited property, from Middle English {it}chet{/it} escheat, short for {it}eschete{/it} {ma}{mat|escheat|}{/ma}
shortdef: the act or an instance of fraudulently deceiving : deception, fraud
a code (such as a button combination or password) that activates a hidden feature or capability in a computer or video game

dt: {bc}the biochemical basis of heredity consisting of codons in DNA and RNA that determine the specific amino acid sequence in proteins and appear to be uniform for nearly all known forms of life

shortdef: the biochemical basis of heredity consisting of codons in DNA and RNA that determine the specific amino acid sequence in proteins and appear to be uniform for nearly all known forms of life

dt: {bc}either of two codes consisting of variously spaced dots and dashes or long and short sounds used for transmitting messages by audible or visual signals

shortdef: either of two codes consisting of variously spaced dots and dashes or long and short sounds used for transmitting messages by audible or visual signals

dt: {bc}a computer program after translation from source code usually into machine language by a compiler

shortdef: a computer program after translation from source code usually into machine language by a compiler

dt: {bc}a code of laws concerning crimes and offenses and their punishment

shortdef: a code of laws concerning crimes and offenses and their punishment
